comments:
In the Specify a Driver and Connection Details page of the connection profile wizard, the driver definitions is not being saved.

1) open Data Source Explorer
2) Right click on Database then select New...
3) Select SQL Model-JDBC connection and click Next
4) Enter any name and click next to the Specify a Driver and Connection Details
5) Click on the ... button to open Driver Defintion wizard
6) create any defintion and click OK
7) Back to the Specify a Driver and Connection Details page and the driver defintion is not save.

I can't reproduce this in the DTP 0.9 5/4 build with Eclipse 3.2RC2. One thing I did notice is that the newly created driver definition is not selected by default after you exit the wizard and return to the generic JDBC connection profile page -- you have to drop the combo box and then select it.

I had the same problem in the DTP 0.9 5/8 build with Eclipse 3.2RC2. 
In addition, I got an error at console as follows. 

OS: Windows XP sp2 Japanese version
Build: dtp-sdk_0.9RC3_N050806 + eclipse-SDK-3.2RC2-win32

Sorry. Some character was garbled in my comments. 
It said 'org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[-1]: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Invalid encoding name "UTF8"'. 

This value should be change to the correct name "UTF-8".

Brian,

Notice the Japanese locale for the machine below. Is this related to the recent changes in driver defs?

I am experiencing the same problem using DTP0.9RC2, Sun JDK 1.4.2_08, win32, en_US. 

FYI, I have tried downloading DTP at least 4 different times over the past few months and everytime I have encountered basic bugs like this one. I can't help but believe this is related to the lack unit tests in your CVS source tree. DTP seems to have a lot of potential. What it seems to really need is a good suite of unit tests to hopefully prevent these types of embarrasing bugs. I can only hope that your fix for this particular problem will include a unit test.

- Ron

Hi John and Brian,
I am able to reproduce this using dtp-sdk_0.9RC3_N050406 as well as 05/05 and 05/09 drivers. I set up a clean envirnment using Eclipse 3.2RC2 SDK, EMF 2.2.0RC2 and GEF 3.2RC2. After I create a  driver definition it does not appear in the combo box  in the Driver details page.I have attached the log, there are some other erros as well.
Can you pls take a look, this will block the TVT

Quy,
 Since this is blocking many TVT test cases, can you change the status to blocking (i am assuming this is reproducible).Only the owner or the assignee can do this.
Delivered a fix to change the encoding string from "UTF8" to "UTF-8", though I (like John) am not able to duplicate the issue on the English version of Windows.
FWIW, I am having the problem using the English version of windows along with the Xerces 2.8.0 parser.
We tested the fix in a build (thanks Rupesh!) and it seems to fix the problem. Can you verify Quy?
Could you please tell me the date of the build which contains the fix.  Thanks.
Probably tomorrow morning's build. There were some speed issues with uploading the new build this afternoon. I'd wait for the next build to be posted on the DTP site tomorrow morning sometime.
Can't get a good connection to the download server. Will post this build first thing in the morning.
